Description: Terracotta figure of Aphrodite on a swan. The swan swims to the right and wavelets are depicted. Aphrodite sits on the swan's back with her left arm round its neckagainst which she leans. Her right hand is in her lap. Her garment is a mantle thrown over her left shouldar and around her legs. Mould-made (two [part mould) and hollow with a plain back with a round vent. White coating with traces of paint (pink flesh and mantle and blue water) Red-brown clay with light surfaces. Chipped, missing both heads of Aphrodite and swan.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Date and provenance based upon description in register and unpublished catalogue by Edgar. Possibly an import or more likely an early Ptolemaic production from Naukratis or Alexandria.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.631) (Phase 3)
